intro: Jacquemontia loefgrenii, commonly known as the Mexican moonflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, white, night-blooming flowers. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and twining stems that climb or trail along the ground. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in rocky or wooded areas. Its blooming period typically occurs in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths.
